# INAddMediaIntentResponse

**Class**

An intents handler’s response to an add media intent.

## Declaration

```swift
class INAddMediaIntentResponse
```

## Overview

Use an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAddMediaIntentResponse] object to specify the results after the user attempts to add the specified media. After performing the add action using the criteria specified in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAddMediaIntent] object, create an instance of this class with the results of the action. Siri communicates the status from your response to the user at appropriate times.

You create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAddMediaIntentResponse] object in the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAddMediaIntentHandling/confirm(intent:completion:)] and [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAddMediaIntentHandling/handle(intent:completion:)] methods of your add media handler object. For more information about implementing your handler object, see [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INAddMediaIntentHandling].

## Initializing the Response Object

- **init(code:userActivity:)**: Initializes the response object with the specified code and user activity object.

## Providing the Response Code

- **code**: A response code that indicates whether the app successfully added the media.
- **INAddMediaIntentResponseCode**: Codes returned by an app or Intents app extension when handling or confirming an add media intent.

## Add Media

- **INAddMediaIntentHandling**: The handler interface that adds media.
- **INAddMediaIntent**: A request to add a media item.

## Inherits From

- INIntentResponse

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
